analyzed: sa dṛṣṭe dharme yadi ājñām tā rāgayati sarvatas niḥśeṣam avīta rāga tvāt praṇidhāna vaśena kāmadhātau upapadyate kṣipra parinirvāṇa artham
translated: If he attains the state of knowing in this very life, he is reborn in the desire realm by the power of his vow, without completely abandoning passion, for the sake of quickly attaining final nirvāṇa, because he is not completely free from passion.

analyzed: abhisamaya vyavasthānam daśavidham
translated: The establishment of realization is of ten kinds.

original: tatra dharmābhisamayaḥ satyādhipateyeṣu sūtrādiṣu dharmeṣu paratoghoṣamadhipatiṃ kṛtvā dhimātrasyādhimuktiprasādasya paścimamokṣabhāgīyasaṃgṛhītasya 🔽pratilambhaḥ /
analyzed: tatra dharma abhisamayaḥ satya ādhipateyeṣu sūtra ādiṣu dharmeṣu paratas ghoṣam adhipatim kṛtvā dhimātrasya adhimukti prasādasya paścima mokṣa bhāgīya saṃgṛhītasya  pratilambhaḥ
translated: Among them, the realization of the Dharma is the attainment of the highest faith and clarity of conviction, included in the final stage leading to liberation, with the teachings such as the sūtras that have the truths as their subject matter as the dominant condition.

analyzed: tathā hi tad adhimukti prasāda pratilambhāt tāni satyāni dharma abhisamayena abhisamitāni iti ucyante
translated: Because it is said that those truths are realized by the realization of the Dharma through the attainment of that faith and clarity of conviction.

analyzed: artha abhisamayaḥ teṣu eva dharmeṣu yoni śas manaskāram adhipatikṛtvā adhimātrāyāḥ satyeṣu dharma nidhyāna kṣānte
translated: The realization of objects is the attainment of the supreme receptivity to the knowledge of dharmas with regard to the truths, based on proper mental attention to those very dharmas.

analyzed: paścima nirvedha bhāgīya saṃgṛhītāyāḥ pratilambhaḥ
translated: It is included in the last stage leading to penetration.

original: sā punardharmanidhyānakṣāntistrividhena yoniśomanaskāreṇa prabhāvitā adhimātramṛdunā tajjanmakāleṣūṣmagateṣu /🔽adhimātramadhyena mūrdhvasu kṣāntiṣu ca /
analyzed: sā punar dharma nidhyāna kṣāntiḥ trividhena yoniśas manaskāreṇa prabhāvitā adhimātra mṛdunā tad janma kāleṣu ūṣma gateṣu  adhimātra madhyena mūrdhvasu kṣāntiṣu ca
translated: Moreover, that receptivity to the knowledge of dharmas is manifested by three kinds of proper mental attention: by the supreme-weak kind, at the times of birth of the heats;

analyzed: adhimātra adhimātreṇa laukikeṣu agra dharmeṣu iti
translated: by the supreme-middling kind, in the summits; and by the supreme-supreme kind, in the supreme worldly dharmas.

analyzed: tattva abhisamayaḥ darśana mārgaḥ
translated: The realization of reality is the path of seeing.

original: tatra punaḥ satyavyavasthāpanānyabhisamayāntikāni saṃvṛtijñānāni pratilambhato lokottarajñānādhipatyena
analyzed: tatra punar satya vyavasthāpanāni abhisamaya antikāni saṃvṛti jñānāni pratilambhataḥ lokottara jñāna ādhipatyena
translated: Moreover, the knowledges of conventional [truth] at the end of realization, which establish the truths, are attained by the supremacy of supramundane knowledge,

original: tadabījapoṣaṇānna tu sammukhīkaroti ṣoḍaśānāṃ darśanamārgacittakṣaṇānāṃ nirantaratvena
analyzed: tad abīja poṣaṇāt na tu sammukhīkaroti ṣoḍaśānām darśana mārga citta kṣaṇānām nirantara tvena
translated: but not by actualizing them, because of the uninterruptedness of the sixteen moments of mind of the path of seeing.
There is no opportunity for mundane mind.

analyzed: pṛṣṭha abhisamayaḥ darśana mārgāt ūrdhva sarva bhāvanā mārgaḥ laukikaḥ lokottaraḥ vā
translated: The subsequent realization is the entire path of cultivation after the path of seeing, whether mundane or supramundane.

analyzed: ratna abhisamayaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ vata bhagavān
translated: The realization of the jewels is: The Blessed One is truly a perfect Buddha.

analyzed: su ākhyātaḥ sya dharma vinayaḥ
translated: His Dharma and Vinaya are well-proclaimed.

original: supratipannaḥ śrāvakasaṃgha ityevamavetya niścityāryaśrāvakasya buddhādiṣu prasādaḥ /
analyzed: su pratipannaḥ śrāvaka saṃghaḥ iti evam avetya niścitya ārya śrāvakasya buddha ādiṣu prasādaḥ
translated: His Saṅgha of disciples practices well. Having understood and ascertained this, the noble disciple has confidence in the Buddha and so forth.

analyzed: asamudācāra abhisamayaḥ yasya a karaṇa saṃvarasya ayaṃkānta śīla saṃgṛhītasya lābhāt tad vipakṣa naraka ādi asamudācāram
translated: The realization of non-occurrence is when, through obtaining the restraint of non-action included in the cherished morality, one ascertains that the adverse elements such as hell are not occurring.

original: pratyevaṃ niścayaḥ pravarttate kṣoṇā me narakāḥ ityevamādiḥ so 'samudācārābhisamayaḥ /
analyzed: prati evam niścayaḥ pravarttate kṣoṇāḥ me narakāḥ iti evamādiḥ saḥ samudācāra abhisamayaḥ
translated: My hells are destroyed, and so forth. This is the realization of non-occurrence.

original: niṣṭhābhisamayaḥ sarvadauṣṭhulyānāṃ pratiprasrabdhirityevamādiryathā mārgasatye niṣṭhāmārgo nirdiṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: niṣṭhā abhisamayaḥ sarva dauṣṭhulyānām pratiprasrabdhiḥ iti evamādiḥ yathā mārga satye niṣṭhā mārgaḥ nirdiṣṭaḥ
translated: The realization of culmination is as explained in the truth of the path, such as the complete tranquilization of all forms of latent tendency.

original: eta eva saptābhisamayāḥ śrāvakāṇāṃ paratoghoṣamāgamya pratilambhataḥ śrāvakābhisamaya ityucyate /
analyzed: ete eva sapta abhisamayāḥ śrāvakāṇām paratas ghoṣam āgamya pratilambhataḥ śrāvaka abhisamayaḥ iti ucyate
translated: These very seven realizations, when obtained by the disciples in dependence on the teachings of others, are called the realization of the disciples.

analyzed: paratas ghoṣam an āgamya pratilambhataḥ pratyekabuddha abhisamayaḥ iti
translated: When obtained without dependence on the teachings of others, it is called the realization of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: bodhisattvābhisamaya eṣu saptasvabhisamayeṣu bodhisattvasya yā samudāgamakṣāntiḥ śrāvakapratyekabuddhavinayopāyakauśalyārthaṃ Abhidhsbh
analyzed: bodhisattva abhisamaye eṣu saptasu abhisamayeṣu bodhisattvasya yā samudāgama kṣāntiḥ śrāvaka pratyekabuddha vinaya upāya kauśalya artham
translated: This is the acceptance of complete attainment by the bodhisattva in these seven realizations, for the sake of the skill in means of guiding śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

analyzed: no tu sākṣātkriyā sattva apekṣayā hīna yāna aniryāṇāt
translated: But it is not direct realization, because of the escape from the inferior vehicle out of concern for beings.

original: api khalu tatprathamato bodhisattvasya bhūmipraveśābhisamaya ityucyate //
analyzed: api khalu tat prathamatas bodhisattvasya bhūmi praveśa abhisamayaḥ iti ucyate
translated: Moreover, that is called the bodhisattva's realization of entering the stages, right at the beginning.

original: etaṃ cābhisamaya niśrityocyate śrāvakābhisamayādbodhisattvābhisamasya kaḥ prativiśeṣaḥ ālaṃbanaviśeṣato vaipulyālaṃbanatvāt /
analyzed: etam ca abhisamaya niśritya ucyate śrāvaka abhisamayāt bodhisattva abhisamasya kaḥ prativiśeṣaḥ ālaṃbana viśeṣataḥ vaipulya ālaṃbana tvāt
translated: And relying on this realization, it is said: What is the difference between the bodhisattva's realization and the śrāvaka's realization? By the difference in object, because of taking the extensive as object.

analyzed: upastambha viśeṣataḥ paripūrṇa mahā kalpa asakhyeya mahā puṇya jñāna saṃbhāra paripūraṇāt
translated: By the difference in support, because of completing the great accumulations of merit and knowledge, which are not to be completed in a great eon.

original: prativedhaviśeṣataḥ pudgaladharmanairātmyādhipateyadharmaprayogavedhato lokottareṇa jñānena tadubhayaprativedhāt abhyupagamaviśeṣataḥ svātmasamatayā
analyzed: prativedha viśeṣataḥ pudgala dharma nairātmya ādhipateya dharma prayoga vedhataḥ lokottareṇa jñānena tad ubhaya prativedhāt abhyupagama viśeṣataḥ svātma samatayā
translated: By the difference in penetration, because of penetrating both of those by supramundane knowledge, by the application of the dharma of the supremacy of the selflessness of persons and dharmas. By the difference in acceptance,

analyzed: sarva sattva abhyupagamāt
translated: because of accepting all beings as equal to oneself.

analyzed: niryāṇa viśeṣataḥ daśabhiḥ bhūmibhiḥ niryāṇāt
translated: By the difference in escape, because of escaping by the ten stages.

analyzed: parigraha viśeṣataḥ pratiṣṭhita nirvāṇa parigrahaṇāt
translated: It is superior in terms of embracing, because it embraces the nirvāṇa that is not attached to anything.

analyzed: pratiṣṭhā parivāra viśeṣataḥ buddhakṣatra pariśīdhanāt vineya jana upagrahaṇāt ca
translated: It is superior in terms of establishment and retinue, because it establishes and attracts the retinue in the Buddha-fields.

analyzed: abhijanma viśeṣataḥ pitṛ vaṃśa saṃdhāraka aurasa putra lakṣaṇa tvāt
translated: It is superior in terms of noble birth, because it is characterized as the son born of the father's own womb who continues the family line.

analyzed: janma viśeṣataḥ pariṣad maṇḍaleṣu upapannaḥ  phala viśeṣaḥ ca punar āśraya parivṛtti viśeṣataḥ kliṣṭa akliṣṭa sarva prakāra dauṣṭhulya prahāṇāt sarva niruttara guṇa āśraya tvena āśraya parivartanāt
translated: It is superior in terms of birth, because it is born in the circles of assemblies.

analyzed: guṇa samṛddhi viśeṣataḥ balavat śāradya āveṇika buddha dharma ādi aparimita guṇa niṣpatteḥ
translated: And it is superior in terms of fruit, because it is the basis for the attainment of immeasurable qualities such as the powers, the fearlessnesses, and the unique qualities of a Buddha.

analyzed: pañca ākāra viśeṣataḥ viśuddhi ādi viśeṣāt
translated: It is superior in terms of five aspects, because of the superiority of purification and so forth.

analyzed: tatra viśuddhi viśeṣaḥ sa vāsanā kleśa prahāṇāt
translated: Among them, the superiority of purification is due to the abandonment of afflictions along with their traces.

analyzed: pariśuddhi viśeṣaḥ buddhakṣetra pariśodhanāt
translated: The superiority of purification is due to the purification of the Buddha-fields.

analyzed: kāya viśeṣaḥ dharmakāya pariniṣpādanāt
translated: The superiority of body is due to the accomplishment of the Dharma-body.

original: bhogaviśeṣaḥ sadā bodhisattveḥ saha parṣanmaṇḍaleṣu vicitradharmasaṃbhogāt /
analyzed: bhoga viśeṣaḥ sadā bodhisattveḥ saha parṣad maṇḍaleṣu vicitra dharma saṃbhogāt
translated: The superiority of enjoyment is due to the enjoyment of various teachings always with the assembly of Bodhisattvas in the circles.

original: kamaviśeṣo yathārhaṃ nirmāṇeḥ samantādanantāparyanteṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhakṛtyānuṣṭhānāditi /
analyzed: kama viśeṣaḥ yathārham nirmāṇeḥ samantāt anantā paryanteṣu lokadhātuṣu buddha kṛtyā anuṣṭhānāt iti
translated: The difference in action is due to the performance of Buddha's duties in all the infinite world systems as appropriate through emanations.

analyzed: kāya traya viśeṣataḥ svabhāvika sāmbhāgika nairmāṇika kāya pariniṣpatti lābhāt
translated: Due to the attainment of the perfection of the three bodies - natural, shared, and transformation.

analyzed: nirvāṇa viśeṣataḥ nirupadhi śeṣe nirvāṇa dhātau sarva sattva hitāya sarva guṇa a samucchedāt
translated: Due to the difference in nirvana, because for the sake of all beings, all qualities are not cut off in the realm of nirvana without remainder.

original: miśropamiśrajñānaśaktilābhaviśeṣataḥ suviśuddhadharmadhātvekarasatayā tadāśritāsu sarvākāravarajñatāsu pratyekaṃ sarvabuddhānāṃ sāmarthyāt
analyzed: miśra upamiśra jñāna śakti lābha viśeṣataḥ su viśuddha dharmadhātu ekarasa tayā tad āśritāsu sarva ākāra vara jñatāsu pratyekam sarva buddhānām sāmarthyāt
translated: Due to the attainment of the difference in the power of mixed and unmixed knowledge, because all Buddhas individually have the ability in all the supreme knowledges that are based on the single taste of the very pure dharmadhatu.

analyzed: āvaraṇa viśuddhi viśeṣataḥ sarva kleśa jñeya āvaraṇa prahāṇāt
translated: Due to the difference in the purification of obstructions, because all afflictive and cognitive obstructions are eliminated.

analyzed: miśra upamiśra karma kriyā viśeṣataḥ ekaika sattva vinayanam prati sarva buddha ādhipatyāt
translated: Due to the difference in the performance of mixed and unmixed actions, because all Buddhas have dominion over the taming of each individual being.

original: abhisaṃbodhinirvāṇasaṃdarśanopāyaviśeṣato daśasu dikṣu yathāyogaṃ sarvalokadhātuṣu yāvadaparāntaṃ punaḥpunarbuddhotpādādi saṃdarśanena sarvavineyajanaparipācanavimocanāt
analyzed: abhisaṃbodhi nirvāṇa saṃdarśana upāya viśeṣataḥ daśasu dikṣu yathāyogam sarva lokadhātuṣu yāvat apara antam punar punar buddha utpāda ādi saṃdarśanena sarva vineya jana paripācana vimocanāt
translated: Due to the difference in the method of displaying enlightenment and nirvana, because all those to be tamed are matured and liberated through the display of the arising of Buddhas again and again in all world systems in the ten directions as appropriate until the end of time.

analyzed: pañca ākāra paritrāṇa viśeṣataḥ ca
translated: And by the special fivefold protection.

analyzed: veditavyaḥ upadrava ādi paritrāṇāt
translated: It should be known that the Buddha protects from harm, etc.

analyzed: tatra upadrava paritrāṇam nagara praveśa ādibhiḥ randhā ādīnām cakṣuḥ ādi pratilambhāt
translated: Among them, protection from harm is by entering the city, etc., and by the blind, etc. obtaining eyes, etc.

analyzed: an upāya paritrāṇam laukika samyak dṛṣṭi pratilambhena sarva kudṛṣṭi vivecanāt
translated: Protection from non-means is by attaining worldly right view, due to being free from all wrong views.

original: apāyaparitrāṇaṃ darśanamārgotpādanena durgatisamatikramaṇāt satkāyaparitrāṇamarhattvasākṣātkaraṇena traidhātukavi mokṣāṇāt /
analyzed: apāya paritrāṇam darśana mārga utpādanena durgati samatikramaṇāt satkāya paritrāṇam arhat tva sākṣātkaraṇena traidhātuka vi
translated: Protection from bad destinies is by producing the path of seeing, due to transcending bad destinies. Protection from the body of existence is by actualizing arhatship, due to being liberated from the three realms.

analyzed: yāna paritrāṇam bodhisattvānām hīna yāna vicchandanāt iti
translated: Protection from vehicles is for bodhisattvas, due to being free from the desire for the lesser vehicle.

original: vaiśaṃṣikaguṇā āryaśrāvakairbhāvanāmārge vābhinirhriyante 'śaikṣamārge vetyata eṣāṃ pṛṣṭhaniṣṭhābhisamayābhyāṃ saṃgraho veditavyaḥ /
analyzed: vaiśaṃṣika guṇāḥ ārya śrāvakaiḥ bhāvanā mārge vā abhinirhriyante śaikṣa mārge vā iti atas eṣām pṛṣṭha niṣṭhā abhisamayābhyām saṃgrahaḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: The special qualities are accomplished by noble disciples either on the path of cultivation or on the path of no-more-learning. Therefore, they should be known as included in the proximate and final realizations.

original: te punarmaitryādayo yathāsūtrāntareṣu nirdiṣṭāḥ śrāvakayāne mahāyāne ca tathaiva veditavyāḥ /
analyzed: te punar maitrī ādayaḥ yathā sūtra antareṣu nirdiṣṭāḥ śrāvaka yāne mahāyāne ca tathā eva veditavyāḥ
translated: Moreover, the loving-kindness, etc. should be known just as they are taught in other sūtras, both in the vehicle of the hearers and in the Great Vehicle.

original: teṣāṃ cāya samāsena pañcabhirākārairyathāyogaṃ lakṣaṇanirdeśo veditavyaḥ niśrayata ālaṃbanata ākārataḥ svabhāvataḥ sahāyataśca //
analyzed: teṣām samāsena pañcabhiḥ ākāraiḥ yathāyogam lakṣaṇa nirdeśaḥ veditavyaḥ niśrayataḥ ālaṃbanataḥ ākārataḥ svabhāvataḥ sahāyataḥ ca
translated: And their characteristics should be understood in brief by five aspects, as appropriate: basis, object, aspect, nature, and companion.

analyzed: tatra tāvat maitryā dhyānam niśrayaḥ
translated: Among them, the basis of loving-kindness is meditation.

analyzed: sattvāḥ ālaṃbanam
translated: Beings are the object.

analyzed: sukhena saṃprayujyeran iti ākāraḥ
translated: The aspect is May they be united with happiness.

analyzed: samādhiḥ prajñā ca svabhāvaḥ śamatha vipaśyanā saṃgṛhīta tvāt sarva guṇānām
translated: Concentration and wisdom are the nature, because all virtues are included in tranquility and insight.

original: cittacaitasikāḥ sahāyā ityevaṃ karuṇādiṣu yathāyogaṃ yojayitavyam /
analyzed: citta caitasikāḥ sahāyāḥ iti evam karuṇā ādiṣu yathāyogam yojayitavyam
translated: Mind and mental factors are the companions. Thus, compassion and so on should be applied as appropriate.

original: upekṣayā sukhādiṣu sattveṣvanunayādyabhyupekṣaṇamaho vata saṃkleśādvimucyerannityayamākāro veditavyaḥ /
analyzed: upekṣayā sukha ādiṣu sattveṣu anunaya ādi abhyupekṣaṇam aho vata saṃkleśāt vimucyeran iti ayam ākāraḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: With equanimity, the aspect should be understood as May they be indifferent to attachment and so on towards beings who are happy and so on.

analyzed: sa ca hita āśaya vihāraḥ iti ucyate
translated: And that is called the dwelling of the intention for benefit.

analyzed: aṣṭau vimokṣāḥ
translated: There are eight liberations.

original: rūpī rūpāṇi paśyatyayaṃ prathamo vimokṣa iti vistaraḥ /
analyzed: rūpī rūpāṇi paśyati ayam prathamaḥ vimokṣaḥ iti vistaraḥ
translated: One who has form sees forms. This is the first liberation, and so on in detail.

analyzed: tatra katham rūpī iti ucyate
translated: Among them, how is one said to have form?

original: svātmanyā rūpyasamāpattisaṃniśrayeṇa rūpasaṃjñāyā abhibhāvanādrūpasaṃjñāsaṃniveśanādvā draṣṭavyāni rūpasaṃjñāsaṃmukhī karaṇādityarthaḥ /
analyzed: sva ātmanyā rūpya samāpatti saṃniśrayeṇa rūpa saṃjñāyāḥ abhibhāvanāt rūpa saṃjñā saṃniveśanāt vā draṣṭavyāni rūpa saṃjñā saṃmukhī karaṇāt iti arthaḥ
translated: It should be seen as the non-appearance of form-perception or the establishment of formless-perception, based on the attainment of formlessness in one's own self. The meaning is the manifestation of the perception of formlessness.

analyzed: katham rūpāṇi paśyati iti ucyate
translated: How is it said that one sees forms?

analyzed: suvarṇa durvarṇa ādīni rūpāṇi adhimucya darśanāt
translated: Because one sees forms such as beautiful and ugly by resolving on them.

analyzed: katham vimokṣaḥ iti ucyate
translated: How is it said to be a liberation?

analyzed: vimucyate nena nirmāṇa āvaraṇāt iti kṛtvā
translated: Because by this one is liberated from the obstruction to emanation.

analyzed: adhyātmam arūpa saṃjñā ārūpya samāpatti saṃniśrayeṇa draṣṭari sva ātmani rūpa saṃjñā vibhāvanā darūpa saṃjñā saṃniveśanāt vā draṣṭari nāma saṃjñā saṃmukhīkaraṇāt iti arthaḥ
translated: Based on the attainment of formlessness with the perception of formlessness internally, it is because the perception of form in the seer, one's own self, is eliminated, the perception of formlessness is established, and the perception of name in the seer is manifested.

analyzed: śeṣam pūrvavat
translated: The rest is as before.

analyzed: śubham vimokṣam kāyena sākṣātkṛtvā upasaṃpadya viharata
translated: Having realized and attained the liberation of beauty with the body, one dwells.

analyzed: śubha aśubheṣu rūpeṣu anyonya apekṣā saṃjñām anyonya anugama saṃjñām ca niśritya anyonya eka rasa saṃjñā lābhāt
translated: Based on the perception of mutual dependence and the perception of mutual conformity in beautiful and ugly forms, one attains the perception of mutual oneness.

original: Abhidhsbh tathāhi śubhāni rūpāṇyapekṣya tadanyeṣvaśubhānīti bhavatyaśubhāni vāpekṣya śubhānīti nānapekṣyaikajātīyānāmeva darśane śubhāśubhatābuddhyabhāvāt
analyzed: abhidhsbh  tathā hi śubhāni rūpāṇi apekṣya tad anyeṣu aśubhāni iti bhavati aśubhāni vā apekṣya śubhāni iti na an apekṣya eka jātīyānām eva darśane śubha aśubha tā buddhi abhāvāt
translated: For, indeed, taking into account the beautiful forms, the other forms are considered ugly. Or taking into account the ugly forms, the beautiful forms are considered ugly. Not taking into account, because when only forms of one kind are seen, there is no conception of beauty or ugliness.

analyzed: tathā hi śubheṣu api a śūbha tā anugata aśubheṣu api śubha tā
translated: For, indeed, even in the beautiful there is a tendency to ugliness, and even in the ugly there is beauty.

original: śubhasaṃmatasyāpi tvaṅmātrasya keśādiṣaṭtriśadaśucidravyāntarabhāvādityevamanyonyaṃ sarvarūpāṇi miśrayitvā śubhataikarasākārayā saṃjñayā vimucyate
analyzed: śubha saṃmatasya api tvac mātrasya keśa ādi ṣaṭtriśat aśuci dravya antara bhāvāt iti evam anyonyam sarva rūpāṇi miśrayitvā śubha tā eka rasa ākārayā saṃjñayā vimucyate
translated: But even what is considered beautiful is impure, because it is included among the thirty-six impure substances such as hair. Thus, having mixed all forms with each other in this way, one is liberated by the perception that has the single taste of beauty.

original: tasyaivaṃ rūpādivimokṣavibhutvalābhinaḥ śubhāśubhanirmāṇāvaraṇaṃ ca prahīyate tatra ca saṃkleśotpattyāvaraṇam /
analyzed: tasya evam rūpa ādi vimokṣa vibhu tva lābhinaḥ śubha aśubha nirmāṇa āvaraṇam ca prahīyate tatra ca saṃkleśa utpatti āvaraṇam
translated: For him who has thus attained mastery over the liberation of form, etc., the obstruction to creating the beautiful and the ugly is abandoned, and also the obstruction to the arising of defilement there.

analyzed: kaḥ punarnirmāṇe saṃkleśaḥ  śubha rūpa nirmāṇe ābhogaḥ
translated: What, then, is defilement in creation?🔽In creating beautiful form, there is effort.

analyzed: aśubha rūpa nirmāṇe prātikūlyam iti
translated: In creating ugly form, there is aversion.

original: ākāśānantyāyatanādīni catvāryāryaśrāvakasya yānyanāśravānukūlāni śuddhāni tāni vimokṣakākhyāṃ labhante /
analyzed: ākāśa anantya āyatana ādīni catvāri ārya śrāvakasya yāni anāśrava anukūlāni śuddhāni tāni vimokṣaka ākhyām labhante
translated: The four formless attainments beginning with the sphere of infinite space, which are favorable to the uncontaminated state of the noble disciple, are called liberations.

analyzed: tad āsvādana vimokṣaṇāt
translated: Because they liberate from the enjoyment of those.

original: ye te śāntā vimokṣā atikramya rūpāṇyārūpyāsteṣvasaktiḥ pariśuddhiḥ /
analyzed: ye te śāntāḥ vimokṣāḥ atikramya rūpāṇi ārūpyāḥ teṣu asaktiḥ pariśuddhiḥ
translated: The abandonment of attachment to the formless liberations that are peaceful and transcend form is purification.

analyzed: tasyāḥ āvaraṇam ārūpya āsvādanam iti
translated: The obscuration to that is the enjoyment of the formless realms.

analyzed: saṃjñā vedayita nirodhasya niśrayaḥ na eva saṃjñāna asaṃjñā āyatanam
translated: The base of the cessation of perception and feeling is the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception.

analyzed: ālaṃbana ākāra sahāyāḥ na santi citta caitasikānām abhāvāt
translated: There is no object, aspect, or aid, because there is no mind or mental factors.

analyzed: svabhāvaḥ tasya citta caitasikānām nirodhaḥ
translated: Its nature is the cessation of mind and mental factors.

analyzed: sa ca mokṣa anusadṛśaḥ vihāraḥ
translated: And that is a dwelling similar to liberation.

analyzed: lokottareṇa mārgeṇa parivṛti āśrayasya ārya śrāvakasya punar cita caitasikānām api apravṛtti avasthāyāḥ parama śānta tvāt kliṣṭa mano samudācārāt ca
translated: By turning away through the supramundane path, it is the state of non-occurrence of mind and mental factors again for the noble disciple, because of the highest peace and because of the non-operation of the defiled mind.

analyzed: ete ca aṣṭau vimokṣāḥ vihārāḥ iti ucyante
translated: And these eight liberations are called dwellings.

analyzed: ebhiḥ āryāṇām viharaṇāt
translated: Because the noble ones dwell in them.

analyzed: tatra api bahulam ābhyām vimokṣābhyām viharanti
translated: And they dwell mostly in these two liberations.

analyzed: tṛtīyena aṣṭamena ca pradhāna tvāt
translated: Because the third and eighth are primary.

original: ata eva cānayoḥ kāyena sākṣātkṛtyopasaṃpadya viharatīti vacanaṃ nānyeṣu rūpyarūpivimokṣāvaraṇāśeṣaprahāṇādyathākramam /
analyzed: atas eva ca anayoḥ kāyena sākṣātkṛtya upasaṃpadya viharati iti vacanam na anyeṣu rūpya rūpi vimokṣa āvaraṇa aśeṣa prahāṇāt yathākramam
translated: For this very reason, only these two are said to be actualized by the body and attained and dwelt in, not the others, because of the complete abandonment of the obscurations to the form and formless liberations respectively.

analyzed: tayoḥ saṃpūrṇa āśraya parivṛtti sākṣātkaraṇam upādāya iti aparaḥ paryāyaḥ
translated: The other permutation is: because of the realization of the complete transformation of the basis of those two.

original: aṣṭāvabhibhvāyatanāni tatra adhyātmaṃ rūpasaṃjñī bahirdhā rūpāṇi paśyati parīttāni suvarṇadurvarṇāni hīnapraṇī tāni /🔽tāni khalu Abhidhsbh
analyzed: aṣṭau abhibhvāyatanāni tatra adhyātmam rūpa saṃjñī bahirdhā rūpāṇi paśyati parīttāni suvarṇa durvarṇāni hīna praṇītāni  tāni khalu abhidhsbh
translated: There are eight spheres of mastery. In that regard, one with the perception of form internally sees forms externally as limited, beautiful and ugly, inferior and excellent.🔽Those forms,

original: rūpāṇyabhibhūya jānātyabhibhūya paśyati tathā ca saṃjñī bhavati /
analyzed: rūpāṇi abhibhūya jānāti abhibhūya paśyati tathā ca saṃjñī bhavati
translated: having overcome, one knows and sees, and one becomes aware of it in that way.

analyzed: idam prathamam abhibhu āyatanam
translated: This is the first sphere of mastery.

original: adhyātmaṃ rūpasaṃjñī bahirdhā rūpāṇi paśyatyadhimātrāṇi suvarṇadurvarṇāni vistareṇa yāvattayā ca saṃjñī bhavati /
analyzed: adhyātmam rūpa saṃjñī bahirdhā rūpāṇi paśyati adhimātrāṇi suvarṇa durvarṇāni vistareṇa yāvat tayā ca saṃjñī bhavati
translated: One with the perception of form internally sees forms externally as extensive, beautiful and ugly, in detail up to one becomes aware of it in that way.

analyzed: idam dvitīyam abhibhvāyatanam
translated: This is the second sphere of mastery.

original: ityete dve abhibhvāyatane rūpī rūpāṇi paśyatītyetasmādvimokṣādabhinirhriyete /
analyzed: iti ete dve abhibhvāyatane rūpī rūpāṇi paśyati iti etasmāt vimokṣāt abhinirhriyete
translated: Thus these two spheres of mastery are manifested from that liberation called one with form sees forms.

original: adhyātmamarūpasaṃjñī bahirdhā rūpāṇi paśyati parīttāni vistareṇa yāvattathāsaṃjñī ca bhavati /
analyzed: adhyātmam arūpa saṃjñī bahirdhā rūpāṇi paśyati parīttāni vistareṇa yāvat tathā saṃjñī ca bhavati
translated: One with the non-perception of form internally sees forms externally as limited, in detail up to one becomes aware of it in that way.

analyzed: idam tṛtīyam abhibhvā āyatanam
translated: This is the third sphere of mastery.

original: adhyātmamarūpasaṃjñī bahirdhā rūpāṇi paśyatyadhimātrāṇi yathā tathāsaṃjñī ca bhavati /
analyzed: adhyātmam arūpa saṃjñī bahirdhā rūpāṇi paśyati adhimātrāṇi yathā tathā saṃjñī ca bhavati
translated: One perceives forms externally as gross, and one has the perception of them as such.

analyzed: idam caturtham abhibhvā āyatanam
translated: This is the fourth sphere of mastery.

original: ityete dve abhibhvāyatane adhyātmamarūpasaṃjñī bahirdhā rūpāṇi paśyatītyeta smādvimokṣādabhinirhriyete /
analyzed: iti ete dve abhibhvāyatane adhyātmam arūpa saṃjñī bahirdhā rūpāṇi paśyati iti eta smāt vimokṣāt abhinirhriyete
translated: Thus, these two spheres of mastery are brought forth from this liberation, namely, perceiving forms internally as non-existent, one sees forms externally as gross, and one has the perception of them as such.

original: evaṃ kṛtvā dvābhyāṃ vimokṣābhyāṃ catvāryabhibhvāyatanāni veditavyāni /
analyzed: evam kṛtvā dvābhyām vimokṣābhyām catvāri abhibhvā āyatanāni veditavyāni
translated: Having done so, the four spheres of mastery should be understood from two liberations.

original: adhyātmamarūpasaṃjñī bahirdhā rūpāṇi paśyati nīlāni nīlavarṇāni nīlanidarśanāni nīlanirbhāsāni /
analyzed: adhyātmam arūpa saṃjñī bahirdhā rūpāṇi paśyati nīlāni nīla varṇāni nīla nidarśanāni nīla nirbhāsāni
translated: One perceives forms internally as non-existent, but sees forms externally as blue, of blue color, of blue luster.

original: tadyathā umakāpuṣpaṃ saṃpannaṃ vā vārāṇasīyakaṃ vastraṃ nīlaṃ nīlavarṇa nīlanidarśanaṃ
analyzed: tat yathā umakāpuṣpam saṃpannam vā vārāṇasīyakam vastram nīlam nīla varṇa nīla nidarśanam
translated: Just like the Umakā flower, or a cloth from Vārāṇasī dyed blue, blue in color, of blue luster,

original: nīlanirbhāsamevamevādhyātmamarūpasaṃjñī bahirdhā rūpāṇi paśyati nīlāni yāvannīlanirbhāsāni
analyzed: nīla nirbhāsam evam eva adhyātmam arūpa saṃjñī bahirdhā rūpāṇi paśyati nīlāni yāvat nīla nirbhāsāni
translated: in the same way, one perceives forms internally as non-existent, but sees forms externally as blue, up to blue in luster.

original: tāni khalu rūpāṇyabhibhūya jānātyābhibhūya paśyati tathāsaṃjñī ca bhavati /
analyzed: tāni khalu rūpāṇi abhibhūya jānāti ā abhibhūya paśyati tathā saṃjñī ca bhavati
translated: One knows those forms by overpowering them, one sees by overpowering them, and one has the perception of them as such.

analyzed: idam pañcamam abhibhvā āyatanam
translated: This is the fifth sphere of mastery.

original: adhyātmamarūpasaṃjñī bahirdhā rūpāṇi paśyati pītāni yāvatpītanirbhāsāni /
analyzed: adhyātmam arūpa saṃjñī bahirdhā rūpāṇi paśyati pītāni yāvat pīta nirbhāsāni
translated: One perceives internally no form, but sees forms externally as yellow, up to as yellow in color.

original: tadyathā karṇikārapuṣpaṃ saṃpannaṃ vā vārāṇasīyakaṃ vastraṃ pītaṃ pītavarṇamiti vistaraḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā karṇikāra puṣpam saṃpannam vā vārāṇasīyakam vastram pītam pīta varṇam iti vistaraḥ
translated: Just as a Karnikara flower, or as Benares cloth, which is yellow, of yellow color, of yellow luster.

analyzed: idam ṣaṣṭham abhibhvā āyatanam
translated: This is the sixth sphere of mastery.

original: adhyātmamarūpasaṃjñī bahirdhā rūpāṇi paśyati lohitāni yāvallohitanirbhāsāni /
analyzed: adhyātmam arūpa saṃjñī bahirdhā rūpāṇi paśyati lohitāni yāvat lohita nirbhāsāni
translated: One perceives internally no form, but sees forms externally as red, up to as red in color.

original: tadyathā bandhujīvakapuṣpaṃ saṃpannaṃ vā vārāṇasīyaṃ vastraṃ lohitaṃ lohitavarṇamiti vistaraḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā bandhujīvaka puṣpam saṃpannam vā vārāṇasīyam vastram lohitam lohita varṇam iti vistaraḥ
translated: Just as a Bandhujivaka flower, or as Benares cloth, which is red, of red color, of red luster.

analyzed: idam saptamam abhibhvā āyatanam
translated: This is the seventh sphere of mastery.

analyzed: adhyātmam arūpa saṃjñī bahirdhā rūpāṇi paśyati avadātāni avadāta varṇāni avadāta nidarśanāni avadāta nirbhāsāni
translated: One perceives internally no form, but sees forms externally as white, of white color, of white appearance, of white luster.

original: tadyathā uṣasi tārakāyā varṇaṃ saṃpannaṃ vā vārāṇasīyakaṃ vastramavadātamavadātavarṇamavadātanidarśanamavadātanirbhāsamevamevādhyātmamarūpasaṃjñī
analyzed: tat yathā uṣasi tārakāyāḥ varṇam saṃpannam vā vārāṇasīyakam vastram avadātam avadāta varṇam avadāta nidarśanam avadāta nirbhāsam evam eva adhyātmam arūpa saṃjñī
translated: Just as the morning star, or as Benares cloth, which is white, of white color, of white appearance, of white luster. In the same way, one perceives internally no form,

analyzed: bahirdhā rūpāṇi vadātāni avadāta varṇāni avadāta nidarśanāni avadāta nirbhāsāni
translated: One sees external forms as white, of white color, of white luster.

original: tāni khalu rūpāṇyabhibhūya jānātyabhibhūya paśyati tathāsaṃjñī ca bhavati /
analyzed: tāni khalu rūpāṇi abhibhūya jānāti abhibhūya paśyati tathā saṃjñī ca bhavati
translated: One knows and sees those forms as they are, and one has the perception of them as they are.

analyzed: idam aṣṭamam abhibhvā āyatanam
translated: This is the eighth sphere of mastery.

original: etāni catvāri śubhaṃ vimokṣaṃ kāyena sākṣātkṛtvopasaṃpadya viharatītyetasmādvimokṣādabhinirhriyate //
analyzed: etāni catvāri śubham vimokṣam kāyena sākṣātkṛtvā upasaṃpadya viharati iti etasmāt vimokṣāt abhinirhriyate
translated: These four are manifested from that liberation by actualizing and entering the liberation of the beautiful in the body.

analyzed: tatra vimokṣaiḥ ālaṃbanam adhimucyate parītta ādikam
translated: There, in the liberations, one is liberated from the object such as the small, etc.

analyzed: abhibhu āyatanaiḥ tu abhibhavati
translated: But in the spheres of mastery, one overcomes.

analyzed: tad antardhānāt yatheṣṭam vā karaṇāt vaśa vartamāna tām upādāya
translated: Because one can make them disappear or do as one wishes, one has mastery over them.

analyzed: tatra parīttāni rūpāṇi sattva saṃkhyātāni alpa pramāṇa tvāt
translated: There, the small forms are those counted as sentient beings, because they are of small size.

analyzed: adhimātrāṇi asattva saṃkhyātāni gṛha vimāna parvata ādīni
translated: The large ones are those not counted as sentient beings, such as houses, palaces, mountains, etc.,

analyzed: mahā pramāṇa tvāt
translated: because they are of great size.

analyzed: suvarṇa durvarṇāni śubha aśubha varṇa saṃgṛhītāni
translated: The beautiful and ugly ones are included in good and bad colors.

analyzed: hīna praṇītāni mānuṣyaka divyāni yathākramam
translated: The inferior and superior ones are human and divine, respectively.

analyzed: tāni khalu rūpāṇi abhibhūya iti vaśe vartayitvā
translated: One knows and sees those forms as they are, and one has the perception of them as they are.

analyzed: jānāti iti śamatha mārgeṇa
translated: One knows means by the path of serenity.

analyzed: paśyati iti vipaśyanā mārgeṇa
translated: One sees means by the path of insight.

original: tathāsaṃjñī ca bhavatītyabhibhūte nābhibhūte vā tannirabhimānasaṃjñitāmupādāya /
analyzed: tathā asaṃjñī ca bhavati iti abhibhūte na abhibhūte vā tat nirabhimāna saṃjñi tām upādāya
translated: And one has the perception of it as it is means that one has the perception of non-conceit towards what is overcome or not overcome.

analyzed: nīlāni iti uddeśa padam  nīla varṇāni sahajām nīla tām upādāya  nīla nidarśanāni saṃyoga nīla tām upādāya
translated: Blue is the term of designation.🔽Blue in color means the innate blueness.🔽Blue in appearance means the combined blueness.

analyzed: nīla nirbhāsāni tad ubhayoḥ prabhā nirmokṣa bhāsvara tām upādāya
translated: Blue in radiance means the radiance of both of those.

analyzed: yathā nīlāni evam pīta lohita avadātāni vistareṇa veditavyāni
translated: As with blue, so with yellow, red, and white, it should be understood in detail.

analyzed: dṛṣṭānta dvayam ca ekaikasmin sahaja sāṃyogika varṇa udbhāvana tām upādāya
translated: And the two examples are for each, because they bring out the innate and combined colors.

analyzed: aparaḥ paryāyaḥ tat yathā nīlam iti puṣpa vastrayoḥ samānam uddeśa padam
translated: Another permutation is as follows: Blue is the common term of designation for both a flower and a cloth.

analyzed: nīla varṇam iti puṣpam eva adhikṛtya
translated: Blue in color refers only to the flower.

analyzed: tasya sāṃyogika nīla tva saṃbhavāt
translated: Because it can have a combined blueness.

analyzed: nīla nirbhāsam iti ucyate puṣpa vastre adhikṛtya
translated: Blue in appearance is said with reference to both the flower and the cloth.

analyzed: dvayoḥ api bhāsvara tva saṃbhavāt
translated: Because both can have radiance.

original: ityevaṃ kṛtvā dṛṣṭānte 'pi tadyathomakāpuṣpaṃ saṃpannaṃ vā vārāṇasīyakaṃ vastraṃ nīlaṃ nīlavarṇamityevamādinirdeśa upapanno bhavati /
analyzed: iti evam kṛtvā dṛṣṭānte tat yathā umakāpuṣpam saṃpannam vā vārāṇasīyakam vastram nīlam nīla varṇam iti evamādi nirdeśaḥ upapannaḥ bhavati
translated: Thus, even in the example, the statement like a blue lotus flower or a blue cloth from Varanasi becomes reasonable.

analyzed: evam pīta ādikam yojayitavyam
translated: The same should be applied to yellow and so on.

analyzed: śiṣṭam yathā adhimokṣeṣu
translated: The rest is as in the meditations.

analyzed: kim śiṣṭam
translated: What is the rest?

analyzed: adhyātmam rūpa saṃjñī bahirdhā rūpāṇi paśyati iti evamādi
translated: One with the perception of form internally sees forms externally.

original: tatpunaryathā rūpī rūpāṇi paśyatītyevamādi nirdeśānusāreṇa draṣṭavyam //
analyzed: tat punar yathā rūpī rūpāṇi paśyati iti evamādi nirdeśa anusāreṇa draṣṭavyam
translated: That should be seen according to the explanation of one who has form sees forms and so on.

original: evamabhibhvāyatanairālaṃbanaṃ vaśe vartayitvā kṛtsnāyatanaiḥ kṛtsnaṃ spharati samantānantā paryantaṃ vistārayatītyarthaḥ /
analyzed: evam abhibhū āyatanaiḥ ālaṃbanam vaśe vartayitvā kṛtsna āyatanaiḥ kṛtsnam spharati samantā anantā paryantam vistārayati iti arthaḥ
translated: Thus, having brought the object under control with the spheres of mastery, one fills it completely with the spheres of totality, meaning one expands it to the farthest reaches of the endless and boundless.

analyzed: tāni punar kṛtsna āyatanāni daśa bhavanti
translated: Moreover, those spheres of totality are ten.

original: tadyathā pṛthivīkṛtsnamapkṛtsnaṃ tejaḥkṛtsnaṃ vāyukṛtsnaṃ pītakṛtsnaṃ lohitakṛtsnamavadātakṛtsnamākāśānantyāyatanakṛtsnaṃ vijñānānantyāyatanakṛtsnaṃ
analyzed: tat yathā pṛthivī kṛtsnam ap kṛtsnam tejaḥ kṛtsnam vāyu kṛtsnam pīta kṛtsnam lohita kṛtsnam avadāta kṛtsnam ākāśa ānantya āyatana kṛtsnam vijñāna ānantya āyatana kṛtsnam
translated: Namely, the totality of earth, the totality of water, the totality of fire, the totality of wind, the totality of yellow, the totality of red, the totality of white, the totality of the sphere of infinite space, the totality of the sphere of infinite consciousness,

analyzed: ca
translated: and the totality of the sphere of nothingness.

original: kṛtsnāyataneṣu pṛthivyādīni yadi na vyavasthāpyeran tenāśrayamahābhūtairvinā tadupādāyarūpaṃ nīlādiakaṃ spharituṃ na śakyeta /
analyzed: kṛtsna āyataneṣu pṛthivī ādīni yadi na vyavasthāpyeran tena āśraya mahābhūtaiḥ vinā tad upādāya rūpam nīla ādiakam spharitum na śakyeta
translated: If earth, etc. were not established in the spheres of totality, the derivative form such as blue, etc. based on those great elements as support would not be able to pervade.

original: tasyāśrayasya rūpasya spharaṇasamṛddhimupādāyaiṣāṃ kṛtsneṣu vyavasthānaṃ veditavyam /
analyzed: tasya āśrayasya rūpasya spharaṇa samṛddhim upādāya eṣām kṛtsneṣu vyavasthānam veditavyam
translated: The establishment of these in the spheres of totality should be understood based on the successful pervasion of that form which is the support.

analyzed: śeṣam yathāsaṃbhavam vimokṣavat ākāśa ānantya āyatana kṛtsna ādi
translated: The rest are as appropriate, like the liberations, such as the sphere of infinite space and totality.

analyzed: tatra vimokṣaiḥ ārambhaḥ
translated: Among them, the liberations are the beginning.

analyzed: abhibhvā āyataneḥ prayogaḥ
translated: The spheres of mastery are the practice.

analyzed: kṛtsna āyatanaiḥ pariniṣpattiḥ vimokṣāṇām veditavyāḥ
translated: The spheres of totality should be known as the completion of the liberations.

original: araṇā vihārī yeṣāṃ sattvānāmābhāsaṃ gantukāmo bhavati teṣāmātmani Abhidhsbh
analyzed: araṇā vihārī yeṣām sattvānām ābhāsam gantu kāmaḥ bhavati teṣām ātmani
translated: For those who dwell in the state of non-conflict, when one wishes to go into the presence of beings, one should first enter the state of non-conflict.

original: kleśasamudācāramadhikṛtyānāgatavṛttāntaṃ vihāragata eva praṇidhijñāna balenāvalokya🔽tathā tatsamīpamupasaṃkrāmati na vā yathā te tatrānunayapratidherṣyāmātsaryādikaṃ
analyzed: kleśa samudācāram adhikṛtya anāgata vṛttāntam vihāra gate eva praṇidhi jñāna balena avalokya  tathā tad samīpam upasaṃkrāmati na vā yathā te tatra anunaya pratidhā īrṣyā mātsarya ādikam
translated: Then, while still in the monastery, one should observe with the power of knowledge resulting from resolve the future events with regard to the arising of afflictions.

analyzed: kleśa upakleśa saraṇam na utpādayanti
translated: Then one should approach them or not, as appropriate, so that they do not give rise to afflictions and secondary afflictions such as attachment, aversion, jealousy, and stinginess.

original: ata idamucyate 'raṇā dhyānaṃ niśritya kleśotpattyanurakṣāvihārasamṛddhāviti vistaraḥ /
analyzed: atas idam ucyate dhyānam niśritya kleśa utpatti anurakṣā vihāra samṛddhau iti vistaraḥ
translated: Therefore, this is said: Based on the dhyāna of non-conflict, the successful practice of guarding against the arising of afflictions, and so on.

analyzed: praṇidhi jñānam tad lābhī yat yat eva traiyadhvika ādika jñeya vṛttāntam jñātu kāmaḥ bhavati
translated: The knowledge of aspiration is when one who has attained that, whatever object of knowledge belonging to the three times, etc., one wishes to know,

original: tatra tatra mānasaṃ praṇidhāyedaṃ jānīyāmiti dhyānaṃ samāpadyate /
analyzed: tatra tatra mānasam praṇidhāya idam jānīyām iti dhyānam samāpadyate
translated: having directed the mind there, thinking I should know this, one enters dhyāna.

analyzed: tatas vyutthitasya tat praṇidhānam samṛdhyati
translated: Then, for one who has emerged from that, that aspiration is successful.

analyzed: tat jñeyam jānāti iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that one knows that object of knowledge.

analyzed: dharma pratisaṃvid paryāyeṣu
translated: The analytical knowledge of phenomena is with regard to synonyms.

analyzed: tat yathā avidyā ādīn ārabhya ajñānam adarśanam anabhisamayaḥ iti evamādiṣu avyāghāta samṛddhau yaḥ samādhiḥ iti vistaraḥ
translated: For example, starting from ignorance, it is the successful practice of non-obstruction in knowing such things as non-knowledge, non-seeing, and non-realization.

analyzed: artha pratisaṃvid sva sāmānya lakṣaṇe dharmāṇām  artha antara ādi abhiprāye ca avyāghāta samṛddhau iti vistaraḥ
translated: The analytical knowledge of meaning is with regard to the specific and general characteristics of phenomena.🔽And it is the successful practice of non-obstruction in the intention of other meanings.

analyzed: nirukti prati saṃvid janapada bhāṣāyām iti prati viṣayam yathāsvam anyonya saṃjñā antara anuvyavahāre
translated: The analytical knowledge of language is with regard to the languages of different countries, in the mutual conventions of different names according to each one's own language.

original: dharmanirvacane ceti tadyathā lujyate pralujyate tasmāllokaḥ /
analyzed: dharma nirvacane ca iti tat yathā lujyate pralujyate tasmāt lokaḥ
translated: And with regard to the definitions of phenomena, for example, it is called the world because it is broken and falls apart.

analyzed: rūpyate tasmāt rūpaḥ iti evamādike
translated: It is manifested, therefore it is form, and so on.

original: pratibhānapratisaṃviddharmaprabhedeṣviti dravyasantaḥ prajñaptisantaḥ saṃvṛtisantaḥ paramārthasanta ityevamādiṣu //
analyzed: pratibhāna pratisaṃvid dharma prabhedeṣu iti dravya santaḥ prajñapti santaḥ saṃvṛti santaḥ paramārtha santaḥ iti evamādiṣu
translated: In the analytical knowledge of eloquence, in the distinctions of dharmas, such as substantially existent, nominally existent, conventionally existent, ultimately existent, and so on.

original: ṛddhayabhijñā vicitraddhivikuvitasamṛddhāviti tadyathā eko bhūtvā bahudhā bhavatītyevamādau /
analyzed: ṛddhaya abhijñāḥ vicitra ddhi vikuvita samṛddhau iti tat yathā ekaḥ bhūtvā bahudhā bhavati iti evamādau
translated: The supernormal knowledge of supernatural powers is the successful accomplishment of various kinds of transformations, such as becoming one after being many, and so on.

analyzed: vicitrāṇām śabdānām anuśrava samṛddhau iti divya mānuṣyaka ādīnām
translated: The successful accomplishment of hearing various kinds of sounds, such as divine, human, and so on.

analyzed: para sattveṣu citta carita praveśa samṛddhau iti sa rāga ādi citta pracāra yathā bhūta jñāna samṛddhau iti arthaḥ
translated: The successful accomplishment of penetrating the mental activities of other beings, meaning the successful accomplishment of knowing as it truly is the mental activities with passion, and so on.

analyzed: pūrva anta caryāyāḥ anusmaraṇa samṛddhau iti atītam janma paraṃparām ārabhya nāma jāti gotra ādi prakāra vṛttāyāḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The successful accomplishment of recollecting past lives, meaning the recollection of one's own name, lineage, and so on, starting from the present life and continuing in sequence to past lives.

original: cyutyutpādābhijñā divyena cakṣuṣā sattvānāṃ cyavamānānāmupapadyamānānāṃ suvarṇānāṃ
analyzed: cyuti utpāda abhijñāḥ divyena cakṣuṣā sattvānām cyavamānānām upapadyamānānām suvarṇānām
translated: The supernormal knowledge of death and rebirth, by means of the divine eye, of beings passing away and being reborn, of beings of good appearance,

original: durvarṇānāṃ sugatimapi gacchatāṃ durgatimapyaparāntamārabhya cyutyupapādasaṃdarśanasamṛddhau samādhyādayaḥ /
analyzed: durvarṇānām sugatim api gacchatām durgatim api apara antam ārabhya cyuti upapāda saṃdarśana samṛddhau samādhi ādayaḥ
translated: For those of bad complexion who go to good destinies and bad destinies, the concentrations, etc. are perfected in showing death and rebirth in the future.

analyzed: āsrava kṣaya jñāna samṛddhau iti yena upāyena āsravāḥ parikṣoyante
translated: For the perfection of the knowledge of the destruction of the defilements, by which means the defilements are completely destroyed.

analyzed: yaḥ ca eṣām parikṣayaḥ tad jñāna niṣpatti nimittam iti arthaḥ
translated: And the meaning is that the attainment of that knowledge is the cause of their complete destruction.

original: lakṣaṇānuvyañjanāni yatsamādhiprajñādhipatyena buddhā bhagavanto dvātriṃśatā lakṣaṇairaśītyānuvyañjanaiḥ vibhrājamānaṃ rūpakāyaṃ saṃdarśayanti
analyzed: lakṣaṇa anuvyañjanāni yat samādhi prajñā ādhipatyena buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ dvātriṃśatā lakṣaṇaiḥ aśītyā anuvyañjanaiḥ vibhrājamānam rūpakāyam saṃdarśayanti  /
translated: The characteristics and minor marks, by which the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, manifest the radiant form body with thirty-two major and eighty minor marks through the power of concentration and wisdom,

analyzed: vineyānām
translated: for the sake of those to be trained.

analyzed: abhidhsbh tad svabhāvāni tāni teṣām veditavyāni
translated: Those should be known as having that nature.

analyzed: dharmakāya prabhāvita tvāt buddhānām bhagavatām iti
translated: Because the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, manifest the Dharma body.

analyzed: bodhisattvānām tu tathā saṃdarśana samarthānām samādhi prajñā svabhāvāni
translated: But for the Bodhisattvas who are capable of manifesting it in that way, they have the nature of concentration and wisdom.

analyzed: tad anyeṣām parṣad maṇḍaleṣu upapannānām tad samutthita vipāka svabhāvāni veditavyāni
translated: For those born in the assemblies of others, they should be known as having the nature of the ripening that arises from that.

original: catasraḥ sarvakārāḥ pariśuddhayo buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ mahābhijñāprāptānāṃ ca bodhisattvānām /
analyzed: catasraḥ sarvakārāḥ pariśuddhayaḥ buddhānām bhagavatām mahābhijñāprāptānām ca bodhisattvānām
translated: The four all-accomplishments are of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, and of the bodhisattvas who have attained the great higher knowledges.

analyzed: tatra yathākāmam āśrayasya upādāna sthāna parityāgānām samṛddhau iti yatra icchati tatra upapatti grahaṇataḥ
translated: Among them, the accomplishment of the body as desired is the attainment of the taking up, abiding, and relinquishing of the body as one wishes.

analyzed: tasyām ca upapattau āyuḥ saṃskārān adhiṣṭhāya yāvadiccham avasthānataḥ
translated: And in that rebirth, by controlling the life-formations, it is the abiding as long as one wishes.

analyzed: yadā icchati tadā āyuḥ saṃskāra utsarjanataḥ ca yathākramam
translated: By relinquishing the life-formations as one wishes, respectively.

analyzed: yathākāmam ālaṃbanam adhikṛtya nirmāṇa pariṇāmana jñānānām samṛddhau iti a pūrva rūpa ādi nirmāṇataḥ
translated: The accomplishment of the knowledge of magical creation and transformation with regard to the object as desired is the creation of forms, etc. that did not exist before.

analyzed: pūrva utpannānām rūpa ādīnām suvarṇa ādi tvena pariṇāmataḥ
translated: The transformation of forms, etc. that arose previously into gold, etc.

analyzed: sarva prakāra avagamanataḥ ca yathākramam
translated: And the understanding of all aspects, respectively.

analyzed: yathākāmam samādhi mukha vaśavarti samṛddhau iti pratikṣaṇam yathā iṣṭam aparimita samādhi antara samāpattaye
translated: The accomplishment of mastery over the door of concentration as desired is for the attainment of immeasurable other concentrations as desired moment by moment.

analyzed: yathākāmam dhāraṇī mukha saṃdhāraṇa samṛddhau iti kṣarāṇām anyatama akṣara manasikāre tad ādi sarva dharma paryāya abhilapana sāmarthya pratilambhāya iti arthaḥ
translated: As desired, in the accomplishment of retaining the door of retention, it means that in attending to any one of the forty-two letters, one attains the ability to recite all the Dharma teachings beginning with that.

analyzed: daśa balāni sthāna asthāna jñāna balam karma svaka jñāna balam dhyāna vimokṣa samādhi samāpatti jñāna balam indriya para apara jñāna balam
translated: The ten powers are: the power of knowledge of proper and improper, the power of knowledge of one's own deeds, the power of knowledge of meditations, liberations, concentrations, and attainments, the power of knowledge of the higher and lower faculties,

analyzed: nānā adhimukti jñāna balam nānā dhātu jñāna balam sarvatragāminī pratipad jñāna balam pūrva nivāsa anusmṛti jñāna balam
translated: the power of knowledge of various resolves, the power of knowledge of various elements, the power of knowledge of the path going everywhere, the power of knowledge of recollection of past abodes,

analyzed: cyuti upapāda jñāna balam āsrava kṣaya jñāna balam ca
translated: the power of knowledge of death and rebirth, and the power of knowledge of the destruction of defilements.

analyzed: tatra sthāna asthāna jñāna balam dhyānam niśritya sarva prakāra hetu ahetu jñāna asaṃga apratihata saṃmukhībhāve samādhi ādayaḥ
translated: Among them, the power of knowledge of proper and improper, based on meditation, is the unobstructed and unhindered manifestation of the knowledge of all kinds of causes and non-causes, with concentration, etc.

analyzed: evam karma svaka jñāna bala ādiṣu sarva ākāra karma svaka tā jñāna asaṃga apratihata saṃmukhībhāvaḥ iti yojayitavyam
translated: Similarly, in the power of knowledge of one's own deeds, and so on, it should be connected as the unobstructed and unhindered manifestation of the knowledge of all aspects of one's own deeds.

original: catvāri vaiśāradyāni samyaksaṃbuddhasya vata me sata ime te dharmā anabhisaṃbuddhā
analyzed: catvāri vaiśāradyāni samyaksaṃbuddhasya vata me sataḥ ime te dharmāḥ an abhisaṃbuddhāḥ
translated: The four fearlessnesses: These dharmas have not been fully awakened to by me, who am a perfectly awakened one.

original: ityatra māṃ kaścicchramaṇo vā devo vā māro vā brahmā vā sahadharmeṇa codayedvā smārayedvā
analyzed: iti atra mām kaścid śramaṇaḥ vā devaḥ vā māraḥ vā brahmā vā sahadharmeṇa codayet vā smārayet vā
translated: Here, some ascetic, brāhmaṇa, god, Māra, Brahmā, or anyone else in the world might accuse me in accordance with the Dharma, saying,

original: nimittamapi na samanupaśyāmyetacca nimittamasamanupaśyan kṣemaprāptaśca vaiśāradyaprāptaścodāramārṣabhaṃ sthānaṃ prajānāmi /
analyzed: nimittam api na samanupaśyāmi etat ca nimittam a samanupaśyan kṣema prāptaḥ ca vaiśāradya prāptaḥ ca udāram ārṣabham sthānam prajānāmi
translated: I do not see any reason for that, and not seeing any reason, I have attained security and fearlessness, and I know the great sage's abode.

analyzed: brahmacaryam pravartayāmi
translated: I proclaim the holy life.

analyzed: pariṣadi samyak siṃhanādam nadāmi
translated: I roar the lion's roar in the assemblies.

original: kṣīṇāsravasya vata me sata ime āsravā aparikṣīṇā iti /🔽ye vā punarme śrāvakāṇāmantarāyikā dharmā ākhyātāḥ tān pratiṣevamānasya nālamantarāyāteti Abhidhsbh 🔽yo vā punarme śrāvakāṇāṃ niryāṇāya mārga ākhyāta āryonairyāṇiko nairvedhikaḥ sa vata
analyzed: kṣīṇa āsravasya vata me sataḥ ime āsravāḥ a parikṣīṇāḥ iti  ye vā punar me śrāvakāṇām antarāyikāḥ dharmāḥ ākhyātāḥ tān pratiṣevamānasya na alam antarāyāta iti  yaḥ vā punar me śrāvakāṇām niryāṇāya mārgaḥ ākhyātaḥ āryaḥ nairyāṇikaḥ nairvedhikaḥ sa vata
translated: These outflows of mine have not been fully eliminated, who am one with outflows diminished.🔽Those things that I have declared to be obstacles for my disciples, when practiced, do not lead to obstacles.🔽That noble path of mine, which I have declared to be the way out for my disciples, the way leading to the cessation of suffering, the right path, the true path, the path of awakening,

original: na samyaṅniryāti tatkarasya samyagduḥkhakṣayāya duḥkhasyāntakriyāyai ityatra māṃ
analyzed: na samyak niryāti tad karasya samyak duḥkha kṣayāya duḥkhasya anta kriyāyai iti atra mām
translated: does not lead to the complete cessation of suffering, to the end of suffering. Here, some ascetic, brāhmaṇa, god, Māra, Brahmā, or anyone else in the world might accuse me in accordance with the Dharma, saying,

original: kaścit śramaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā yāvatsiṃhanādaṃ nadāmīti vistareṇaikaikasmin vaktavyam /
analyzed: kaścid śramaṇaḥ vā brāhmaṇaḥ vā yāvat siṃhanādam nadāmi iti vistareṇa ekaikasmin vaktavyam
translated: Some ascetic or brahmin... up to... I will roar the lion's roar - this should be stated in detail for each one.

original: tānyetāni vaiśāradyāni svārthaṃ parārthaṃ cārabhya veditavyāni /
analyzed: tāni etāni vaiśāradyāni sva artham para artham ca ārabhya veditavyāni
translated: These confidences should be known as referring to one's own aim and others' aim.

analyzed: tatra dvividhaḥ svārthaḥ jñāna viśeṣaḥ prahāṇa viśeṣaḥ ca
translated: There, one's own aim is twofold: the special knowledge and the special abandonment.

original: dvividhaḥ parārthaḥ vipakṣadharmavivarjanaṃ pratipakṣadharmaniṣevaṇaṃ ca /🔽tatrābhisaṃbodhivaiśāradyaṃ jñānātmakaṃ svārthamevārabhya sarvākāraṃ mayā saprabhedaparyantaṃ🔽jñeyamabhisaṃbuddhamityetasyāḥ pratijñāyāḥ samyaṅniranuyojyatvena sarvasmin loke
analyzed: dvividhaḥ para arthaḥ vipakṣa dharma vivarjanam pratipakṣa dharma niṣevaṇam ca  tatra abhisaṃbodhi vaiśāradyam jñāna ātmakam sva artham eva ārabhya sarvākāram mayā sa prabheda paryantam  jñeyam abhisaṃbuddham iti etasyāḥ pratijñāyāḥ samyak niranuyojya tvena sarvasmin loke
translated: Others' aim is twofold: avoiding the dharmas that are adverse and practicing the dharmas that are remedies.🔽Among them, the confidence in perfect enlightenment refers only to one's own aim, which is of the nature of knowledge, and is of all aspects, up to the varieties,

analyzed: pratiṣṭhāpana samṛddhau yaḥ samādhiḥ iti pūrvavat
translated: because it is said, I have perfectly awakened to all aspects of the knowable. It is accomplished by the samādhi that is fully accomplished in establishing this vow correctly without any fault-finding in the entire world.🔽The rest should be connected in the same way as before.

original: evaṃ śeṣāṇyapi vaiśāradyāni yojayitavyāni /🔽sarvākārāḥ punarāsravāḥ savāsanāḥ kleśā draṣṭavyāḥ /
analyzed: evam śeṣāṇi api vaiśāradyāni yojayitavyāni  sarva ākārāḥ punar āsravāḥ sa vāsanāḥ kleśāḥ draṣṭavyāḥ
translated: The remaining confidences should also be connected in the same way.🔽Moreover, the defilements with their traces should be seen as of all aspects.

original: sarvākārā antarāyikā dharmāḥ sarve sāṃkleśikāḥ vipakṣadharmā draṣṭavyāḥ /
analyzed: sarvākārāḥ antarāyikāḥ dharmāḥ sarve sāṃkleśikāḥ vipakṣa dharmāḥ draṣṭavyāḥ
translated: All the dharmas that are obstacles and all the dharmas that are adverse and afflictive should be seen as of all aspects.

original: sarvākāro nairyāṇiko mārgaḥ prayogamārgamārabhya yāvanniṣṭhāmārgo draṣṭavyaḥ //
analyzed: sarvākāraḥ nairyāṇikaḥ mārgaḥ prayoga mārgam ārabhya yāvat niṣṭhā mārgaḥ draṣṭavyaḥ
translated: The path of all aspects is the path of preparation up to the path of completion.

analyzed: trīṇi āveṇikāni smṛti upasthānāni
translated: The three unique foundations of mindfulness.

original: iha śāstā śrāvakāṇāṃ dharmaṃ deśayatyanukampakaḥ kāruṇiko 'rthakāmo hitaiṣī karuṇāyamānaḥ idaṃ vo bhikṣavo hitāya idaṃ sukhāya idaṃ hitasukhāyeti
analyzed: iha śāstā śrāvakāṇām dharmam deśayati anukampakaḥ kāruṇikaḥ rtha kāmaḥ hita eṣī karuṇāyamānaḥ idam vaḥ bhikṣavaḥ hitāya idam sukhāya idam hita sukhāya iti
translated: Here the Teacher teaches the Dharma to the disciples out of compassion, being merciful, desiring their welfare, wishing them benefit, feeling pity for them, saying Monks, this is for your welfare, this is for your happiness, this is for your welfare and happiness.

original: tasya te śrāvakāḥ śuśrūṣante śrotramavadadhatyājñācittamupasthāpayanti pratipadyante dharmasyānudharmam /
analyzed: tasya te śrāvakāḥ śuśrūṣante śrotram avadadhati ājñā cittam upasthāpayanti pratipadyante dharmasya anudharmam
translated: His disciples listen to him, lend an ear, set their minds on understanding, and practice in accordance with the Dharma.

original: tatra tathāgatasya na nāndī bhavati na saumanasyaṃ na cetasa utplāvitatvamupekṣakastatra tathāgato viharati smṛtaḥ saṃprajānan /
analyzed: tatra tathāgatasya na nāndī bhavati na saumanasyam na cetasaḥ utplāvita tvam upekṣakaḥ tatra tathāgataḥ viharati smṛtaḥ saṃprajānan
translated: There the Realised One does not feel joy, does not feel pleased, and does not feel elated in mind. The Realised One remains equanimous, mindful and clearly aware.

analyzed: idam prathama āveṇikam smṛti upasthānam
translated: This is the first unique foundation of mindfulness.

analyzed: yadā āryaḥ sevate yadā āryaḥ sevamānaḥ rhati gaṇam anuśāsitum
translated: Which the Noble One cultivates, and cultivating which the Noble One is able to instruct the community.

original: punaraparaṃ śāstā śrāvakāṇāṃ dharmaṃ deśayati yāvadidaṃ hitasukhāya /
analyzed: punar aparam śāstā śrāvakāṇām dharmam deśayati yāvat idam hita sukhāya
translated: Again, the Teacher teaches the Dharma to the disciples for their welfare and happiness...

original: tasya te śrāvakā na śuśrūṣante yāvanna pratipadyante dharmasyānudharmam /
analyzed: tasya te śrāvakāḥ na śuśrūṣante yāvat na pratipadyante dharmasya anudharmam
translated: His disciples do not listen, up to they do not practice in accordance with the Dharma.

original: tatra tathāgatasya nāghāto bhavati nākṣāntirnāpratyayo na cetaso 'nabhirāddhirupekṣakastatreti vistaraḥ /
analyzed: tatra tathāgatasya na āghātaḥ bhavati na akṣāntiḥ na apratyayaḥ na cetasaḥ tatra iti vistaraḥ
translated: Therein, the Tathagata has no irritation, no impatience, no lack of confidence, no mental dissatisfaction, he is equanimous, and so on in detail.

analyzed: idam dvitīyam
translated: This is the second.

original: tṛtīye 'yaṃ viśeṣaḥ asyaike śrāvakāḥ śuśrūṣante yāvatpratipadyante dharmasyānudharmameke na śuśrūṣante yāvanna pratipadyante dharmasyānudharmam
analyzed: tṛtīye yam viśeṣaḥ asya eke śrāvakāḥ śuśrūṣante yāvat pratipadyante dharmasya anudharmam eke na śuśrūṣante yāvat na pratipadyante dharmasya anudharmam
translated: In the third, this is the difference: some of his disciples listen, up to they practice in accordance with the Dharma, some do not listen, up to they do not practice in accordance with the Dharma.

original: tatra tathāgatasya na nāndo bhavati yāvaccetaso nābhirāddhiriti /
analyzed: tatra tathāgatasya na nāndaḥ bhavati yāvat cetasaḥ na abhirāddhiḥ iti
translated: Therein, the Tathagata has no joy, up to no mental satisfaction.

analyzed: etāni trīṇi smṛti upasthānāni abhidhsbh
translated: These are the three foundations of mindfulness.

analyzed: śāstuḥ gaṇa parikarṣaṇe yathākramam sarva ākāra anunaya pratigha tad ubhaya saṃkleśa vāsanāyāḥ asamudācāra samṛddhau samādhi ādayaḥ
translated: In the teacher's guidance of the assembly, in the non-occurrence of the increase of all kinds of affection, aversion, and the latent tendencies of both defilements, the concentrations and so on are supreme.

analyzed: trīṇi arakṣāṇi
translated: There are three safeguards.

analyzed: pariśuddha kāya samudācāraḥ tathāgataḥ
translated: The Tathagata has completely pure bodily conduct.

original: nāsti tathāgatasyāpariśuddhakāyasamudācāratā yāṃ tathāgataḥ praticchādayitavyāṃ manyeta kaccinme pare vijānīyuriti /
analyzed: na asti tathāgatasya a pariśuddha kāyasamudācāra tā yām tathāgataḥ praticchādayitavyām manyeta kiṃcid me pare vijānīyuḥ iti
translated: There is no impure bodily conduct of the Tathāgata that he would consider concealing, thinking Perhaps others will know about me.

analyzed: evam vāc manaḥ samudācāra te veditavye
translated: The same should be understood for verbal and mental conduct.

original: ebhirnirvaktavyatayā nirāśaṅkatvātsvayaṃ śāstuvineyajanaparikarṣaṇamārabhya yatheṣṭaṃ nigṛhya prasajyāvavādānuśāsanīprayogaḥ samṛddhayatīti
analyzed: ebhiḥ nirvaktavya tayā nirāśaṅka tvāt svayam śāstu vineya jana parikarṣaṇam ārabhya yatheṣṭam nigṛhya prasajya avavāda anuśāsanī prayogaḥ samṛddhayati iti
translated: By these, because there is no doubt about what should be explained, the application of instruction and advice, restraining as desired, is successful, starting with the teacher's own guidance of the disciples.

analyzed: veditavyam
translated: It should be understood thus.

original: asaṃmoṣadharmatā sarvavineyakāryamārabhya yathāvatkṛtasya bhāṣitasya cābhilapanasamṛddhau samādhyādayaḥ //
analyzed: asaṃmoṣa dharmatā sarva vineya kāryam ārabhya yathāvat kṛtasya bhāṣitasya ca abhilapana samṛddhau samādhi ādayaḥ
translated: The quality of non-forgetfulness is the success in remembering what has been done and what has been said, starting with all the tasks of guiding disciples.

original: vāsanāsamudghātaḥ sarvajñasya sataḥ kleśajñeyāvaraṇaśeṣasūcakānāṃ kāyavākceṣṭitānāmasamudācārasamṛddhau samādhyādayaḥ //
analyzed: vāsanā samudghātaḥ sarvajñasya sataḥ kleśa jñeya āvaraṇa śeṣa sūcakānām kāya vāc ceṣṭitānām asamudācāra samṛddhau samādhi ādayaḥ
translated: The elimination of habitual tendencies is the success in the non-manifestation of bodily and verbal actions that indicate the remaining imprints of afflictive and cognitive obscurations, for one who has omniscience.

original: mahākaruṇā traidhātukāvacareṣu sarvasattveṣu nirantarasarvaprakāraduḥkhālaṃbana karuṇāvihārasamṛddhau samādhyādayaḥ //
analyzed: mahā karuṇā traidhātuka avacareṣu sarva sattveṣu nirantara sarva prakāra duḥkha ālaṃbana karuṇā vihāra samṛddhau samādhi ādayaḥ
translated: Great compassion is the success in abiding with compassion that takes as its object all suffering of all beings in the three realms, in all its aspects and without interruption.

original: aṣṭādaśāveṇikā buddhadharmāstadyathā nāsti tathāgatasya skhalitam /🔽nāsti ravitam /
analyzed: aṣṭādaśa āveṇikāḥ buddha dharmāḥ tat yathā na asti tathāgatasya skhalitam  na asti ravitam
translated: The eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha are as follows: The Tathāgata has no error,🔽no excited speech,

analyzed: na asti muṣitā smṛtiḥ
translated: no loss of mindfulness,

analyzed: na asti asamāhitam cittam  na asti nānātva saṃjñā
translated: no non-concentrated mind,🔽no various perceptions,

analyzed: na asti pratisaṃkhyāya upekṣā
translated: no lack of full awareness,

analyzed: na asti chanda parihāṇiḥ
translated: no lack of desire,

analyzed: na asti vīrya parihāṇiḥ
translated: no lack of effort,

analyzed: na asti smṛti parihāṇiḥ
translated: no lack of mindfulness,

analyzed: na asti samādhi parihāṇiḥ
translated: no lack of concentration,

analyzed: na asti prajñā ari hāṇiḥ
translated: no lack of wisdom,

analyzed: na asti vimukti parihāṇiḥ
translated: no lack of liberation.

analyzed: sarvam tathāgatasya kāya karma jñāna pūrva gamam jñāna anuparivarti
translated: All bodily actions of the Tathāgata are preceded by knowledge and accompanied by knowledge.

analyzed: sarvam vāc karma jñāna pūrva gamam jñāna anuparivarti
translated: All verbal actions are preceded by knowledge and accompanied by knowledge.

original: sarvaṃ manaskarma jñānapūrvagamaṃ jñānānuparivarti /🔽atīte 'dhvanyasaṅgamapratihataṃ jñānam /🔽anāgate 'dhvanyasaṅgamapratihataṃ jñānam /
analyzed: sarvam manaskarma jñāna pūrva gamam jñāna anuparivarti  atīte dhvanya saṅgam apratihatam jñānam  anāgate dhvanya saṅgam a pratihatam jñānam
translated: All mental actions are preceded by knowledge and accompanied by knowledge.🔽His knowledge of the past is unobstructed.🔽His knowledge of the future is unobstructed.

analyzed: pratyutpanne dhvanya saṅgam a pratihatam jñānam iti
translated: His knowledge of the present is unobstructed.

analyzed: eṣām punar vyavasthānam
translated: Now, their classification is as follows.

original: tadyathā arhan bhikṣuḥ kṣīṇāsravaḥ grāmaṃ piṇḍāya carannekadā caṇḍena hastinā sārgha samāgacchati /
analyzed: tat yathā arhan bhikṣuḥ kṣīṇa āsravaḥ grāmam piṇḍāya caran ekadā caṇḍena hastinā sa argha samāgacchati
translated: For example, an arhat bhikṣu, whose defilements are exhausted, when going to the village for alms, sometimes encounters a mad elephant.

analyzed: yathā caṇḍena hastinā evam caṇḍanāśvena
translated: Just as with a mad elephant, so with a mad horse.

original: caṇḍayā gavā /🔽caṇḍena kukkureṇa /🔽gahanaṃ vā kaṇṭakabāṭaṃ vā mṛdnāti /
analyzed: caṇḍayā gavā  caṇḍena kukkureṇa  gahanam vā kaṇṭaka bāṭam vā mṛdnāti
translated: With a mad cow.🔽With a mad dog.🔽He treads on a dense thicket of thorns.

analyzed: alagardam vā padābhyām samākrāmati
translated: He steps with his feet on a snake.

analyzed: tad rūpam vā āgāram praviśati yatra enam mātṛgrāmaḥ yoga vihitena upanimantrayati
translated: He enters a house where a woman invites him with improper conduct.

original: araṇye vā punamārgaṃ hitvā kumārgeṇa gacchati /
analyzed: araṇye vā puna mārgam hitvā ku mārgeṇa gacchati
translated: Or, in the forest, he abandons the path and goes by a wrong path.

original: corairvā taskarairvā sārdhaṃ samāgacchati siṃhairvyāghrairvāparavṛkairvā ityevaṃbhāgīyaṃ skhalitamarhatastathāgatasya sarveṇa sarva nāsti /
analyzed: coraiḥ vā taskaraiḥ vā sārdham samāgacchati siṃhaiḥ vyāghraiḥ vā apara vṛkaiḥ vā iti evaṃbhāgīyam skhalitam arhataḥ tathāgatasya sarveṇa sarva na asti
translated: Or he encounters thieves or robbers, lions, tigers, or other wolves. Such mistakes do not exist at all for the Tathāgata, the Arhat.

analyzed: punar ayam arhan ekadā araṇye pravaṇe nu āhiṇḍan mārgāt apanaśya śūnya āgāram praviśya śabdam udīrayati
translated: Moreover, this arhat, while wandering in the forest on a slope, having lost the path, enters an empty house and utters a sound.

analyzed: ghoṣam anuśrāvayati
translated: He emits a cry.

analyzed: mahārutam ravati
translated: He shouts a loud cry.

analyzed: vāsanā doṣam vā āgamya kliṣṭam mahā hāsam hasati
translated: Due to the fault of habit, he laughs a great laugh, afflicted.

analyzed: danta vidarśakam saṃcagdhitam upadarśayati
translated: He shows the teeth-cleanser, having taken it out and put it in his mouth.

original: ityevaṃbhāgīyamarhato ravitaṃ tathāgatasya sarveṇa sarvaṃ nāsti /
analyzed: iti evaṃbhāgīyam arhataḥ ravitam tathāgatasya sarveṇa sarvam na asti
translated: Thus, the Tathāgata does not have any of these faults of the Arhat.

analyzed: na asti tathāgatasya muṣitā smṛtiḥ akliṣṭa cira kṛta cira bhāṣita anusmaraṇa tām
translated: The Tathāgata does not have a lapse of memory, taking it as a basis for remembering what was done or said a long time ago without affliction.

analyzed: punar aparam arhan samāpannaḥ samāhitaḥ bhavati vyutthitaḥ samāhitaḥ
translated: Moreover, the Arhat is sometimes concentrated and sometimes not concentrated when rising from concentration.

analyzed: tathāgatasya tu sarva avastham na asti asamāhitam cittam
translated: But for the Tathāgata, there is no mind that is not concentrated at all times.

original: punaraparamarhannekāntenopadhā ca pratikramaṇasaṃjñī bhavati nirupadhike ca nirvāṇe śāntasaṃjñī /
analyzed: punar aparam arhan ekāntena upadhā ca pratikramaṇa saṃjñī bhavati nirupadhike ca nirvāṇe śānta saṃjñī
translated: Moreover, the Arhat is exclusively disgusted with the aggregates and has the notion of returning, and has the notion of peace in nirvana without upadhi.

original: tathāgatasya upadhau nirvāṇe ca nānātvasaṃjñā nāsti /
analyzed: tathāgatasya upadhau nirvāṇe ca nānātva saṃjñā na asti
translated: But for the Tathāgata, there is no notion of diversity in the aggregates or in nirvana.

analyzed: parama upekṣāvihāri tām upādāya
translated: Because he abides in the highest equanimity.

analyzed: punar aparam arhan a pratisaṃkhyāya sattva arthakriyām adhyupekṣate
translated: Moreover, the Arhat sometimes neglects the welfare of beings without consideration.

analyzed: tathāgatasya tu iyam evaṃbhāgīyā a pratisaṃkhyāya upekṣā na asti
translated: But for the Tathāgata, there is no such equanimity without consideration of this kind.

original: punaraparamarhan jñeyāvaraṇaviśuddhimārabhyāprāptaparihāṇyā chandenāpi parihīyate vīrye ṇāpismṛtyā samādhinā prajñayā vimuktyā vimuktijñānadarśanenāpi
analyzed: punar aparam arhan jñeya āvaraṇa viśuddhim ārabhya aprāpta parihāṇyā chandena api parihīyate vīrye samādhinā prajñayā vimuktyā vimukti jñāna darśanena api
translated: Furthermore, the arhat, starting from the purification of the obstacle to the knowable, falls even by will due to the loss of what has not been attained, and also by vigor, mindfulness, concentration, wisdom, liberation, and the insight of the knowledge of liberation.

analyzed: parihīyate
translated: He falls.

analyzed: iti iyam sapta ākārā parihāṇiḥ tathāgatasya na asti
translated: This sevenfold loss does not exist for the Tathāgata.

analyzed: punar aparam arhan ekadā kuśale kāya karmaṇi pravartate
translated: Furthermore, the arhat sometimes engages in wholesome bodily action,

analyzed: ekadā avyākṛte
translated: sometimes in indeterminate [action].

analyzed: yathā kāya karmaṇi evam vāc karmaṇi manaḥ karmaṇi ca
translated: As with bodily action, so with verbal action and mental action.

original: tathāgatasya trayāṇāmapi karmaṇāṃ jñānapūrvagamatvājjñānānuparivartitvācca nāstyavyākṛtaṃ karma tatra jñānasamutthāpanatāmupādāya jñānapūrvagamam
analyzed: tathāgatasya trayāṇām api karmaṇām jñāna pūrva gama tvāt jñāna anuparivarti tvāt ca na asti avyākṛtam karma tatra jñāna samutthāpana tām upādāya jñāna pūrva gamam
translated: For the Tathāgata, since all three kinds of action are preceded by knowledge and accompanied by knowledge, there is no indeterminate action. There, with regard to the arising of knowledge, [action] is preceded by knowledge.

analyzed: jñāna sahacara tām upādāya jñāna anuparivarti
translated: With regard to being concurrent with knowledge, [action] is accompanied by knowledge.

original: punaraparamarhan traiyadhvikaṃ jñeyavastu na cābhogamātrātpratipadyate yenāsya saktaṃ jñānadarśanaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: punar aparam arhan traiyadhvikam jñeya vastu na ca ābhoga mātrāt pratipadyate yena asya saktam jñāna darśanam bhavati
translated: Furthermore, the arhat does not understand the knowable objects of the three times merely through exertion, by which his knowledge and insight would be obstructed.

original: na ca sarvaṃ pratipadyate yenāsya pratihataṃ jñānadarśanaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: na ca sarvam pratipadyate yena asya pratihatam jñāna darśanam bhavati
translated: Nor does he understand everything, by which his knowledge and insight would be hindered.

analyzed: tathāgataḥ traiyadhvikam ābhoga mātrāt sarvam vastu pratipadyate
translated: The Tathāgata understands all things merely through the range of the three times.

analyzed: tasmāt ete aṣṭādaśā āveṇikāḥ buddha dharmāḥ iti ucyante
translated: Therefore, these are called the eighteen unique qualities of the Buddha.

analyzed: tatra eṣām ādyāḥ ṣaṭ asādhāraṇa kāya vāc manaḥ karma pariśuddhi samṛddhau samādhi ādayaḥ
translated: Among them, the first six are concentration, etc. for the perfection of the purification of body, speech, and mind karma that is not shared in common.

analyzed: tatra na asti skhalitam iti ayam kāya karma pariśuddhim ārabhya
translated: Among them, there is no stumbling begins with the purification of bodily karma.

original: nāsti ravitamityayaṃ vākkarmaparaśuddhimārabhya /🔽tatra nāsti muṣitasmṛtiḥ nāstyasamānitaṃ cittaṃ nāsti nānātvasaṃjñā nāstyapratisaṃkhyāyopekṣetyetaccatuṣṭayaṃ manaskarmapariśuddhimadhikṛtya
analyzed: na asti vāc karma para śuddhim ārabhya  tatra na asti muṣita smṛtiḥ na asti asamānitam cittam na asti nānātva saṃjñā na asti a pratisaṃkhyāya upekṣā iti etat catuṣṭayam manaskarma pariśuddhim adhikṛtya
translated: There is no chattering begins with the purification of verbal karma.

analyzed: veditavyam
translated: Among them, there is no forgetfulness, there is no unconcentrated mind, there is no perception of multiplicity, there is no indifference without discrimination - these four should be understood in terms of the purification of mental karma.

original: nāsti chandaparihāṇiryāvannāsti vimuktijñānadarśanaparihāṇiriti sāśrayāṇāṃ saphalānāṃ tathāgatendriyāṇāmaprāptyaparihāṇisamṛddhau samādhyādayaḥ
analyzed: na asti chanda parihāṇiḥ yāvat na asti vimukti jñāna darśana parihāṇiḥ iti sa āśrayāṇām sa phalānām tathāgata indriyāṇām aprāpti aparihāṇi samṛddhau samādhi ādayaḥ
translated: There is no loss of desire up to there is no loss of the knowledge and vision of liberation - concentration, etc. are for the perfection of the non-attainment and non-loss of the Tathāgata's faculties with their bases and fruits.

analyzed: tatra āśrayaḥ chandaḥ
translated: Among them, the basis is desire.

analyzed: phalam vimuktiḥ vimukti jñāna darśanam ca
translated: The fruit is liberation and the knowledge and vision of liberation.

analyzed: indriyāṇi vīrya ādīni veditavyāni
translated: The faculties should be understood as beginning with vigor.

original: sarvaṃ kāyakarma vākkarma manaskarma jñānapūrvagamaṃ jñānānuvartītyete trayo 'sādhāraṇakarmacārasamṛddhau samādhyādayaḥ /
analyzed: sarvam kāya karma vāc karma manaḥ karma jñāna pūrva gamam jñāna anuvarti iti ete trayaḥ sādhāraṇa karma cāra samṛddhau samādhi ādayaḥ
translated: All bodily action, verbal action, and mental action are preceded by knowledge and follow knowledge. These three are the concentrations, etc. for perfecting the uncommon activity.

analyzed: atīte dhvanya saṅgam apratihatam jñānam yāvat pratyutpanne dhvani iti ete trayaḥ sādhāraṇa jñāna vihāra samṛddhau samādhi ādayaḥ
translated: The knowledge of the past time is unobstructed and unattached, up to the knowledge of the present time. These three are the concentrations, etc. for perfecting the uncommon knowledge and abiding.

analyzed: skandha dhātu āyataneṣu sarva ākāra jña tā samṛddhau iti skandha ādīnām svabhāva viśeṣa lakṣaṇa prabheda paryanta jñāna niṣpattau iti arthaḥ
translated: In the complete knowledge of all aspects regarding the aggregates, elements, and sense bases. The meaning is: for the attainment of the knowledge of the nature, distinctions, characteristics, and extent of the aggregates, etc.

analyzed: teṣām punar abhinirhāraḥ niśrayataḥ bhinirhāraka pudgalataḥ bhinirhāra upāyataḥ ca paridīpitaḥ
translated: Moreover, their accomplishment is shown by means of the basis, the person who accomplishes, and the means of accomplishment.

original: abhinirhāropāyaḥ punaryathāvyavasthānaṃ manaskārabahulīkāratā yathādeśanaṃ samāhitasya cittasya punaḥpunastatra dhāraṇamityarthaḥ /
analyzed: abhinirhāra upāyaḥ punar yathāvyavasthānam manaskāra bahulīkāra tā yathā deśanam samāhitasya cittasya punar punar tatra dhāraṇam iti arthaḥ
translated: The means of accomplishment is the frequent practice of attention according to the arrangement, the meaning of which is the repeated holding of the mind in concentration according to the teaching.

original: tadyathāpramāṇānyabhinirhartukāmo maṃtrīsahagatena cittenāvaireṇāsapatnenetyevamādikāṃ deśanāṃ dhyānasaṃniśrayeṇa bhāvayan manasikurvan bahulīkaroti /
analyzed: tat yathā pramāṇāni abhinirhartu kāmaḥ maṃtrī sahagatena cittena a vaireṇa a sapatnena iti evam ādikām deśanām dhyāna saṃniśrayeṇa bhāvayan manasikurvan bahulīkaroti
translated: For example, one who desires to manifest the immeasurables, by the mind accompanied with loving-kindness, without enmity, without rivalry, and so on, cultivates and attends to the teaching, and makes it abundant, based on meditation.

original: evamabhijñādīnabhi nirhartukāma eko bhūtvā bahudhā bhavatītyevamādikaṃ vyavasthānaṃ manasikurvan bahulīkarotīti yojayitavyam //
analyzed: evam abhijñā ādīn abhi nirhartu kāmaḥ ekaḥ bhūtvā bahudhā bhavati iti evam ādikam vyavasthānam manasikurvan bahulīkaroti iti yojayitavyam
translated: Similarly, one who desires to manifest the superknowledges and so on, attends to and makes abundant the arrangement beginning with becoming one and becoming many. This should be connected.

analyzed: te ete pramāṇa ādayaḥ guṇāḥ dvi prakārāḥ
translated: These qualities such as the immeasurables are of two kinds.

original: svakāritrapratyupasthānāśca yairāryo yathāyogaṃ vipakṣaprahāṇādikaṃ karma karoti /
analyzed: sva kāritra pratyupasthānāḥ ca yaiḥ āryaḥ yathāyogam vipakṣa prahāṇa ādikam karma karoti
translated: Those that are present for their own function, by which the noble one performs the action of abandoning the opposing factors and so on, as appropriate.

analyzed: vaihārikāḥ ca yaiḥ parama praśānta nirvikalpa jñāna saṃgṛhītaiḥ anālaṃbana apramāṇa ādibhiḥ dṛṣṭe dharme sukham viharati
translated: And those that are for enjoyment, by which one dwells happily in the present life with the supreme, extremely peaceful, non-conceptual knowledge included in the immeasurables and so on that have no object.

original: tatrāpramāṇaivipakṣaṃ prajahātīti yathākramaṃ vyāpādaṃ vihiṃsāmaratimanunayapratighau ca /
analyzed: tatra apramāṇa evipakṣam prajahāti iti yathākramam vyāpādam vihiṃsām aratim anunaya pratighau ca
translated: There, by the immeasurables one abandons the opposing factors, in order: malice, harmfulness, lack of joy, and affection and aversion.

analyzed: etāni ca catvāri apramāṇāni anukampā iti ucyate
translated: And these four immeasurables are called compassion.

analyzed: ebhiḥ sattva artham pratyanuguṇam pravartanāt
translated: Because by them one acts in accordance with the welfare of beings.

analyzed: atas taiḥ viharamāṇaḥ sarva sattveṣu anukampā vihāri tayā puṇya saṃbhāram paripūrayati
translated: Therefore, while dwelling with them, he fulfills the accumulation of merit by dwelling with compassion towards all beings.

original: ata eva sattvaparipāke ca na parikhidyate /🔽sarvasattvānukampitvena svātmanirapekṣatvāt //
analyzed: atas eva sattva paripāke ca na parikhidyate  sarva sattva anukampi tvena sva ātma nirapekṣa tvāt
translated: For this very reason, he is not weary in ripening beings.

analyzed: abhidhsbh
translated: Because he is indifferent to his own self due to his compassion for all beings.

analyzed: vimokṣeṣu dvābhyām vimokṣābhyām nirmāṇa karma abhinirharati
translated: By means of the two liberations, he accomplishes the work of emanation.

analyzed: tṛtīyena śubhe nirmāṇe na saṃkliśyate
translated: By the third, he is not defiled in the good emanation.

analyzed: catubhiḥ ārya vimokṣaiḥ śānteṣu mokṣeṣu na sajjate
translated: By the four noble liberations, he is not attached to the peaceful liberations.

analyzed: praścimena parama praśāntena ārya vihāreṇa viharati
